DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare inhibition platelet aggregation ( ) ticagrelor bivalirudin/heparin versus ( ii ) clopidogrel , eptifibatide heparin patient unstable angina undergoing coronary intervention .
DOC.detailed_description: The first 30 minute PCI procedure outmost importance plaque rupture platelet activation occur . Platelet activation accumulation cause formation blood clot may cause heart attack . As standard care , doctor prescribe medication ticagrelor , eptifibatide , clopidogrel , prevent formation blood clot . 100 patient stable unstable angina , male female , randomize either Group A- Ticagrelor bivalirudin/heparin Group B- Clopidogrel , eptifibatide heparin administrate immediately PCI . Platelet function test ECG perform .
DOC.criteria: Patients stable unstable angina . 1. need oral anticoagulation therapy ( Warfarin , Dabigatran , Rivaroxaban , Apixaban , Edoxaban ) 2. increase risk bradycardia , associate therapy strong cytochrome P450 inhibitor ( antiretroviral agent , antifungal agent antibiotic eg . Indinavir , Nelfinavir , Lopinavir , Ritonavir , Itraconazole , Ketoconazole , Voriconazole , Clarithromycin , Telithormycin ) 3. surgery < 4 week 4. use thienopyridines ( Clopidogrel , Prasugrel ) 7 day prior randomization 5. administration GP IIb/IIIa inhibitor 6. bleed diathesis major bleed episode within 2 week 7. thrombocytopenia ( Platelet count < 100000 ) 8. incessant chest pain 9. hemodynamic instability ( Mean arterial pressure < 65 mm Hg ; need vasopressor inotropic agent ; need mechanical circulatory support coronary intervention ) , NSTEMI evidence elevation troponin level ( Troponin > 0.034 ng/ml ) ; renal failure serum creatinine > 2.0 mg/dL 10. anemia HCT < 30 % .
